column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Culturally appropriate support is important to retaining Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander team members. It can come in many forms, including mentors, skills development, support with personal and work-related issues and providing healing workshops. During the year, the WesCEF Aboriginal Affairs and the Health and Safety teams worked together to organise access to Indigenous psychologists as part of the organisation's existing Employee Assistance Program service.\t
column20: Indigenous psychologists, healing workshop, Employee Assistance Program

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: In May 2023, Bunnings launched an early intervention program for team members supported by health professionals. This program supports leaders and team members should an injury occur, ensuring prompt advice and recovery treatment options are available for team members if required.
column20: An early intervention program, a health professional, injury

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Kmart's Target Your Health program continued to offer support for team members and their families, with a 2.9 per cent increase in team members accessing the program. Ten per cent of team members also participated in the influenza vaccination program, which is a key well-being initiative Target continues to invest in to help its team members be at their best
column20: Target Your Health, vaccination, well-being initiative

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
Work-related injuries
Work-related ill health
Average hours of training per year per employee
Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: WesCEF enhanced its team member recognition program, "Thanks", by streamlining the nomination process by which team members can 'thank' their colleagues for their valuable behaviour or actions with a 28 per cent increase from last financial year in received nominations across the division. Across WesCEF businesses, 470 nominations were received, with 53 individuals or teams receiving awards at a celebratory event in December 2022.
column20: Thanks, recognition program, valuable behaviour

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Wesfarmers leadership model supports self-awareness and continual learning, not perfection. The leadership model was refreshed in 2022 to reflect current and future leadership demands. Wesfarmers uses this model for talent reviews, succession planning and development investment. For the individual leader, the model helps to focus their ongoing development.
column20: Leadership model, self-awareness, continual learning

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Wesfarmers' Officeworks continues to invest in the rollout of its leadership program, SPARK, which aims to support leaders to build their confidence in core management and leadership capabilities. Approximately 250 leaders across the business completed the program between 2021 and 2023. The program is now in its second cohort, with a dedicated delivery to store and customer fulfilment centre coordinators with more than 500 team members commencing the program in May 2023.
column20: SPARK, leadership program, customer fulfilment centre

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Officeworks has begun the rollout of a business-wide capability framework. This practical resource provides team members with a framework for defining what it means to be successful at Officeworks and the skills and capabilities needed for ongoing career progression. It included the rollout of resources enabling team members to drive their development when it suits them best and contribute meaningfully to their careers.
column20: Capability framework, career progression, development

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In November 2022, Officeworks launched LinkedIn Learning as a resource for salaried team members, providing online learning content and allowing them to drive their learning. Since its launch, more than 970 team members have logged in, with an average of 1 hour and 13 minutes of content viewed per viewer.
column20: LinkedIn Learning, online learning content, salaried team member

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In 2023, Wesfarmers' Bunnings launched an online sign language program, Auslan and New Zealand Sign Language, for team members to learn how to support deaf and hard-of-hearing customers and team members. More than 4,800 team members have completed the program since its launch.
column20: Online sign language program, hard-of-hearing, Auslan and New Zealand Sign Language

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column8: Diverse, Inclusive and Respectful Workplaces Policy
column13: Wesfarmers' Diverse, Inclusive and Respectful Workplaces Policy aims to encourage an inclusive work environment where everybody feels safe and respected at work and is designed to foster many facets of diversity in addition to gender, including different ages, ethnicities and backgrounds at all levels in the Group.
column20: Diverse, Inclusive and Respectful Workplaces Policy, work environment, ethnicity

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Wesfarmers introduced initiatives for inclusion of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex, queer and asexual (LGBTIQA+) team members and customers across all divisions. It includes policy reviews, support networks, partnerships with key organisations such as Pride in Diversity, listen-and-learn sessions with team members, marking days of significance and awareness programs.
column20: LGBTIQA+, Pride in Diversity, awareness program

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Wesfarmers' NZ Safety Blackwoods launched a cultural intelligence pilot training program, with the Te Roopu group created to ensure activities to support MÃÂori are 'by MÃÂori for MÃÂori'. It is a group of team members who identify as MÃÂori and represent all functions. Initiatives to support MÃÂori pathways will be co-created in partnership with Te Roopu.
column20: Cultural intelligence pilot, Te Roopu, MÃÂori

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Kmart and Target have continued their focus on gender equity by introducing and enhancing initiatives, including a new leadership training program titled Inclusive Leadership. The program focuses on developing inclusive behaviours of existing leaders to reduce systemic barriers associated with workplace environments, team structures, bias and team member experiences.
column20: Inclusive Leadership, gender equity, systemic barrier

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Wesfarmers' Kmart and Target continued the Deadly Stores program in 161 stores. Deadly Stores operate in communities with a high representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and focus on meaningful employment, cultural confidence and safety. In 2022, Kmart and Target reviewed the Deadly Stores program and, in 2023, launched Deadly Development Stores, which operate in communities with high representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people but require further learning and leadership support to meet the criteria of a Deadly Store.
column20: Deadly Store, cultural confidence, Deadly Development Store

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In the 2023 financial year, 14 Kmart stores participated in the Welcome Here Project as part of a pilot to build LGBTQIA+ awareness and inclusion. The pilot provided team members and leaders with facilitated and online LGBTQIA+ awareness training, resources and the opportunity to wear allyship and pronoun stickers on name badges. Once training was completed, stores displayed 'Welcome Here' stickers, letting customers know Kmart is a safe place to shop for the LGBTQIA+ community.
column20: Welcome Here Project, awareness training, LGBTQIA+

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: In line with Wesfarmers' commitment to pay equity, a Group review of Wesfarmers' salaried workforce's gender pay equity has been conducted annually since 2010, focusing on an annualised fixed pay. The results are reviewed by managing directors across the Group and the Board. Wesfarmers' pay equity review intentionally excludes team members covered by collective agreements, given these instruments determine pay for this cohort, therefore excluding gender as a potential differentiator.
column20: Gender pay equity, annualised fixed pay, pay equity review

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: During the year, WesCEF implemented a Cultural Learning Framework, which included cultural immersion opportunities for the first time. These are interactive learning experiences, such as yarning sessions with community members or teaching the Noongar language to team members.
column20: Cultural Learning Framework, cultural immersion, community member

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: Wesfarmers' Bunnings launched the Your Voice, Worker Call-Back service, facilitating confidential phone interviews with factory workers. This service enables workers to provide feedback and raise concerns about their living or working conditions in a private setting and their native language. The service was expanded to 14 factories during the year and interviewed 130 workers, with no critical incidents identified.
column14: The service was expanded to 14 factories during the year and interviewed 130 workers, with no critical incidents identified.
column20: Your Voice, Worker Call-back, feedback

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: WesCEF is reducing the barriers to engaging Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander businesses as suppliers. The benefits are numerous and far-reaching as financial support flows into local Indigenous communities and the broader economy. As a result, WesCEF initiated the Aboriginal Procurement Working Group to establish processes and a fit-for-purpose framework that outlines how to engage with potential Indigenous suppliers effectively.
column20: Aboriginal Procurement Working Group, Indigenous community, Indigenous supplier

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: In collaboration with Bureau Veritas (BV), a global company that assists businesses with reducing risks, WesCEF established a program that identifies high-risk suppliers that may not meet expected standards. These high-risk suppliers must complete a self-assessment questionnaire (SAQ) process and provide evidence of a social audit completed in the past three years.
column20: Bureau Veritas, high-risk supplier, self-assessment questionnaire
